com.hazelcast.nio

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.serialization.impl.HeapData
      • com.hazelcast.nio.Packet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutboundFrame, Data

    @PrivateApi
public final class Packet
extends HeapData
implements OutboundFrame
    A Packet is a piece of data sent over the wire. The Packet is used for member to member communication. The Packet extends HeapData instead of wrapping it. From a design point of view this is often not the preferred solution (prefer composition over inheritance), but in this case that would mean more object litter. Since the Packet isn't used throughout the system, this design choice is visible locally.

    • Method Detail

      • getConn

        public Connection getConn()
        Gets the Connection this Packet was send with.
        Returns:
        the Connection. Could be null.

      • setConn

        public Packet setConn(Connection conn)
        Sets the Connection this Packet is send with.

        This is done on the reading side of the Packet to make it possible to retrieve information about the sender of the Packet.

        Parameters:
        conn - the connection.
        Returns:
        this (for fluent interface)

      • getPacketType

        public Packet.Type getPacketType()

      • setPacketType

        public Packet setPacketType(Packet.Type type)
        Sets the packet type by updating the packet type bits in the flags bitfield. Other bits are unaffected.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to set
        Returns:
        this (for fluent interface)

      • raiseFlags

        public Packet raiseFlags(int flagsToRaise)
        Raises all the flags raised in the argument. Does not lower any flags.
        Parameters:
        flagsToRaise - the flags to raise
        Returns:
        this (for fluent interface)

      • resetFlagsTo

        public Packet resetFlagsTo(int flagsToSet)
        Resets the entire flags bitfield to the supplied value. This also affects the packet type bits.
        Parameters:
        flagsToSet - the flags. Only the least significant two bytes of the argument are used.
        Returns:
        this (for fluent interface)

      • isFlagRaised

        public boolean isFlagRaised(int flagsToCheck)
        Returns true if any of the flags supplied in the argument are set.
        Parameters:
        flagsToCheck - the flags to check
        Returns:
        true if any of the flags is set, false otherwise.

      • getFlags

        public char getFlags()
        Returns:
        the complete flags bitfield as a char.

      • getPartitionId

        public int getPartitionId()
        Returns the partition ID of this packet. If this packet is not for a particular partition, -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the partition ID.

      • isUrgent

        public boolean isUrgent()
        Description copied from interface: OutboundFrame
        Checks if this Frame is urgent. Frames that are urgent, have priority above regular frames. This is useful to implement System Operations so that they can be send faster than regular operations; especially when the system is under load you want these operations have precedence.
        Specified by:
        isUrgent in interface OutboundFrame
        Returns:
        true if urgent, false otherwise.

      • getFrameLength

        public int getFrameLength()
        Description copied from interface: OutboundFrame
        Returns the frame length. This includes header and payload size.
        Specified by:
        getFrameLength in interface OutboundFrame
        Returns:
        The frame length.
